valid_articles.Description: As part of the DOJ ruling that Google is a monopoly, the document noted that Apple has its own search index and the index size is of billions of websites. The specific number was redacted but it said, "Apple maintains an index of about X billion websites."

valid_articles.Title: Google Business Profiles Performance Report Call Data Gone
valid_articles.Description: Google Business Profiles performance report is no longer showing the "call" tab that shows you statistics and data on searchers who called you from Google Search and Google Maps.  I suspect this might be related to the Google Business Profile call history going away, as we reported earlier.

valid_articles.Title: Google Ads Testing Call Extensions With Advertiser Name

valid_articles.Title: Google Ads Migrating Smart Campaigns To Performance Max
valid_articles.Description: Google Ads will transition the functionality of Smart Campaign into Performance Max campaigns in the coming months.  Google said "Performance Max provides all the same benefits of Smart campaigns and more," in an email sent to one advertiser.

valid_articles.Title: Five reasons why Apple refused to adopt Microsoft Bing as the default search engine for Safari
valid_articles.Description: On August 5, 2024, the District of Columbia U.S. District Court ruled that 'Google effectively shuts out rival search engines due to its massive size, high capital costs, and control of major distribution channels,' acknowledging Google's antitrust violations. In its ruling, the court determined that the contract between Google and Apple played a key role in maintaining Google's monopoly position, and summarized why Apple did not adopt Microsoft Bing, a rival engine to Google.

RT by @glenngabe: Navboost remains one of Google's strongest ranking signals. Even though it’s considered a “traditional” ranking signal, Navboost can beat LLMs and generalization systems (remember, RankBrain, DeepRank, RankEmbed, RankBERT, and MUM) on aspects like freshness 🌱

RT by @glenngabe: Currently, Navboost is trained on 13 months of user data (it used to be 19 months, before 2017). But thirteen months of user data acquired by Google is equivalent to over 17 years of data on Bing 🤯
Google Trends rolls out new trending now page
Daily Search Forum Recap: August 6, 2024
valid_articles.Description:
Here is a recap of what happened in the search forums today, through the eyes of the Search Engine Roundtable and other search forums on the web.

The DOJ ruled Google is a monopoly and action will be taken to limit that.  Google Search rankings are also heating up. Google Search Console has a new recommendations section. Google Business Profiles shows your competitors in the see also carousel. There is a new SEO scam going around. Google served ads for products from other merchants and will issue credits. Google Trends has a new design for trending now results...

Google Search Console Recommendations
valid_articles.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new recommendations feature where Google will show you site improvement recommendations. These recommendations are based on the data in Search Console and aim to help improve your site's performance on Google Search.

valid_articles.Title: Google Search Console rolling out "Recommendations" as an experimental feature (most seems to not have access to it yet) - more insight on this from Google's @johnmu and @danielwaisberg
Google SEO Scam - Pay Google To Fix Your Search Rankings
valid_articles.Description: There is this SEO scam going around where scammers are saying you pay Google to fix your rankings in Google Search. All you need to do is prepay them and Google will fix your site.  John Mueller from Google said "this is a scam," that Google does not offer such a service.

valid_articles.Title: Google Served Ads For Products From Other Merchants
valid_articles.Description: The big Google Ads reporting outage from the eve of August 1st was an intentional outage due to Google serving ads for products from other Google Merchant Center accounts. This was not just an ad spend issue but also a privacy and data issue for Google advertisers. But don't worry, Google will issue credits to the "small fraction of advertisers" that were impacted by this.

valid_articles.Title: Google Trends New Trending Now Design
valid_articles.Description: Google Trends began rolling out a new design for the trending now page a day or so ago.  The new design seems to give you more filter options and provide more keyword data on the same page.

valid_articles.Title: Google Business Profiles Local Listings With See Also
valid_articles.Description: Google is testing the "see also" carousel on Google Business Profiles. This means, someone can be looking directly at your local listing on Google, maybe because they searched for your company name, and Google can be suggesting competitors right under your listing.

valid_articles.Title: Bing Search Ranking Algorithm Update May 29th
valid_articles.Description: Microsoft looks to have pushed out a Bing Search ranking algorithm update around May 29th.  I don't track Bing Search ranking volatility that closely anymore but Glenn Gabe looked back at some data and believes that around May 29, 2024, there was a big Bing core update (if you will). Fabrice Canel from Microsoft responded by saying, no, "nothing unusual was released around this date."

valid_articles.Title: Google Ignores RateLimit Header Fields for HTTP
valid_articles.Description: Google seems to know handle or obey the RateLimit Header Fields for HTTP.  Mike Blazer asked John Mueller from Google about this and John said he never heard of it, so he assumes Google Search does not handle it.

valid_articles.Title: Google Drops "See Results About" Title From Mobile Search Results
valid_articles.Description: Google has dropped the title from the "see results about" disambiguous search feature in the mobile search results interface. The feature is still very much alive, but on mobile search, Google removed the title of it and just shows the feature. On desktop, the title of the search feature remains.

valid_articles.Title: Google Shopping Product Images May Show User Review Images
valid_articles.Description: Google seems to be showing photos from reviews from actual users in the Google Shopping product image carousel.  So when you click on a product listing and then swipe through the images, you may see actual photos submitted by users from their reviews.
